reports.title: Explanation of the Demo
reports.query:
![](https://github.com/neo4j-field/itservicegraph/raw/main/graphics/explanation.png)
[Source on Github](https://github.com/neo4j-field/itservicegraph)

reports.title: Data Model without Properties
reports.query: ![Data Model](https://github.com/neo4j-field/itservicegraph/raw/main/graphics/dm_wo_properties.png)

reports.title: Data Model with Properties
reports.query: ![Data Model](https://github.com/neo4j-field/itservicegraph/raw/main/graphics/dm_w_properties.png)

reports.title: IT Service Graph with combined SecOps Graph
reports.query: CALL db.schema.visualization()

reports.title: # of Clusters
reports.query: MATCH(s:Cluster) RETURN DISTINCT count(s)

reports.title: List of Data Centers
reports.query:
MATCH(s:Datacenter)-[:HAS_LOCATION]->(dcl:DCLocation) 
RETURN DISTINCT s.dcName AS Datacenter, dcl.dcCity AS City;

reports.title: # of Server
reports.query: MATCH(s:Server) RETURN DISTINCT count(s)

reports.title: # of Services
reports.query: MATCH(s:Service) RETURN DISTINCT count(s)

reports.title: # of Customers/Dept.
Servers per Data Center
reports.query:
MATCH(s:Server)-[]->(d:Datacenter)
RETURN d.dcName AS CD, count(s) AS AnzServer;

settings.description: Distribution of Servers to Data Centers.

reports.title: Top 50 Customer List
reports.query:
MATCH(c:Customer)
RETURN c.customerName AS Customer, c.customerDept AS Department, c.customerImportance AS Importance ORDER BY Importance DESC LIMIT 50;

reports.title: Top 100 Services
reports.query:
MATCH(s:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN s.serviceName AS Service, s.serviceOwner AS Owner, s.serviceSLA AS SLA ORDER BY SLA DESC LIMIT 100;

reports.title: Datacenter WAN Interconnections
reports.query:
MATCH (d:DCLocation)-[r:HAS_WAN_CONNECTION]-(d2:DCLocation)
RETURN d, r, d2;

settings.description: This maps shows the WAN Connections between Data Centers. Clicking on the connection will reveal detailed information about the throughput, etc.

reports.title: WAN Connection Details
reports.query:
MATCH (d:DCLocation)-[r:HAS_WAN_CONNECTION]-(d2:DCLocation)
RETURN d.dcName AS From_Datacenter, r.provider AS Provider, r.thruput AS Throughput, r.avgRoundTripMS AS Round_Trip_Time_ms, d2.dcName AS To_Datacenter;

reports.title: Cable Distance between Datacenters
reports.query:
MATCH (d:DCLocation)-[r:HAS_WAN_CONNECTION]->(d2:DCLocation)
RETURN d, r, d2;

settings.description: Hover of one of the connections to see the distance in KM between data centers.

reports.title: Click Server for Impact Analyses
reports.query:
MATCH(s:Server)
RETURN s.serverName AS Server;

settings.description: Click a Server to discover what Services it runs.

reports.title: Impacted Services on selected Server --> $neodash_servername
reports.query:
MATCH(:Server {serverName: $neodash_servername})-[:RUNS]->(s:Service)-[]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN DISTINCT s.serviceName AS Service, s.serviceOwner AS Service_Owner, s.serviceSLA AS SLA, cu.customerName AS CustomerName  ORDER BY SLA DESC;

settings.description: Click a Service to discover its detailed information!

reports.title: Server $neodash_servername --> Services Host Information Chain
reports.query:
MATCH p=(:Rack)<--(:Section)<--(:Datacenter)<--(:Server {serverName: $neodash_servername})<-[:RUNS_ON]-(:Software {swName: $neodash_swname})-[:DELIVERS]->(:Service {serviceName: $neodash_impService})-[]->(:Customer {customerName: $neodash_customer_name})
RETURN p LIMIT 1

settings.description: This show the complete path from the Rack in a Data Center Section up to the user, that booked the Service. It helps to investigate possible problem areas.

reports.title: Customers & Services affected by Server Outage
reports.query:
MATCH p=()--(s:Service)<-[:RUNS]-(:Server {serverName: $neodash_servername})<-[:RUNS_ON]-(:Software {swName: $neodash_swname})
RETURN p

settings.description: This 3D Graph is showing a simulation of what other customers are affected in case the server goes down. A more detailed analysis can be made in the next Dashboard Pages.

reports.title: Affected Customer by selected Service --> $neodash_impService
reports.query:
MATCH(sv:Service {serviceName: $neodash_impService})-[r:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN cu.customerName AS Customer, cu.customerImportance AS SLA_booked, cu.customerDept AS Department, r.customerOnboardDate AS Onboarded_on
ORDER BY SLA_booked DESC

settings.description: Here you see the service owner responsible for the  this service. Depending on the color of the row background, it shows the importance of the SLA. Level 6 is in yellow, Level 7 in orange and the highest levels 8 & 9 are in red. Thus, one can spot the importance immediately.

reports.title: Software Information
reports.query:
MATCH(sv:Service {serviceName: $neodash_impService})<-[]-(sw:Software)
OPTIONAL MATCH (:Software {swName: sw.swName})<--(:Snapshot)<--(:SoftwareComponent)<--(vu:Vulnerability)
WHERE vu.status <> "fixed"
RETURN
sw.swName AS Software, sw.swVersion AS Version, count(vu.status) AS OpenVulnerabilities, sw.swVendor AS Vendor, sw.swLastUpdated AS Last_updated
ORDER BY Version ASC LIMIT 1;

settings.description: Software / Vendor that is used to run the Service and it version, plus the date of the last update. If the last update is more than 6 month back, the Cell will be marked RED.

reports.title: Detailed Information
reports.query: ## Detailed Information about Service $neodash_impService running on server $neodash_servername

reports.title: Data Center & Server Location
reports.query:
MATCH(:Server {serverName: $neodash_servername})-[:LOCATED_IN]->(dc:Datacenter)-[:HAS_LOCATION]->(dl:DCLocation)
RETURN DISTINCT dl AS Datacenter;

settings.description: This map shows the data center location, the selected server / virtual machine / container is hosted.

reports.title: Type in a Service Name:
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Service`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`serviceName`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`serviceName` as value,  n.`serviceName` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

settings.description: Enter a Service Name here, to check its impact on Departments and other Services. All names are generated, so the names start with Service- followed by a 3-digit number and some characters. Try it out!

reports.title: # of affected Departments
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN count(cu.customerName)

settings.description: The departments affected if this services fails due to a software issue, security issue or any other outage.

reports.title: # of Service in cases on SW Issue
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN count(svc2.serviceName)

settings.description: "Simulation" of all other services affected, in case the software has a security issue (e.g. log4j bug) or software bug, so it has to be taken down immediately.

reports.title: # of SW issue affected Departments
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN count(cu)

settings.description: Simulation of all other Departments affected, in case the software has a security issue (e.g. log4j bug) or software bug, so it has to be taken down immediately.

reports.title: Outage Cost per Day in €
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})
RETURN sum(svc.outageCostperHour)*24

settings.description: The service has an attribute (Property) that states the average cost of downtime per hour. That cost is used to calculate the downtime cost per day.

reports.title: Outage Cost per Day in € with other Customers affected
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN sum(svc2.outageCostperHour)*24

settings.description: Same calculation like for the affected service, but now as simulation in case of a security issue (e.g. log4j bug) or software bug, so it has to be taken down immediately.

reports.title: List of affected Customers
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN cu.customerName AS Customer, cu.customerImportance AS Importance, cu.customerDept AS Department ORDER BY Importance DESC

settings.description: Additional details on the affected departments in case of the service being down.

reports.title: List of other affected Customers (Software Issue)
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN cu.customerName AS Customer, cu.customerImportance AS Importance, cu.customerDept AS Department ORDER BY Importance DESC

settings.description: Simulation providing additional details on the affected departments in case of the software used for various services being down.

reports.title: List of other Customers Importance Levels
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN   cu.customerImportance AS Importance, count(cu.customerImportance) AS Count ORDER BY Importance ASC

settings.description: SLA(s) of the directly affected customer(s) to understand, the possible impact on the business of employees affected.

reports.title: Importance Levels - List of other affected Customers (Software Issue)
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN   cu.customerImportance AS Importance, count(cu.customerImportance) AS Count ORDER BY Importance ASC

settings.description: Simulation of SLAs of affected departments / customers to understand, the possible impact on the business in case of a security issue or major software bug.

reports.title: Search a Software Name:
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Software`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`swName`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`swName` as value,  n.`swName` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

settings.description: Type in a Software Name for the impacted Services you want to simulate.

reports.title: Details on Services running using the software --> $neodash_software_swname
reports.query:
MATCH (sw:Software {swName: $neodash_software_swname} )-[]->(svc:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
OPTIONAL MATCH (:Software {swName: $neodash_software_swname})<--(:Snapshot)<--(:SoftwareComponent)<--(vu:Vulnerability)
WHERE vu.status <> "fixed"
RETURN svc.serviceName AS ServiceName, sw.swName AS SoftwareNmae, sw.swVersion AS Version, count(vu.status) AS OpenVulerabilities, sw.swLastUpdated AS LastUpdated, cu.customerName AS Customer;

settings.description: Click a Service to simulate cost and affected customers in case of unavailability!

reports.title: Cost of Downtime per Day in case of the Software $neodash_software_swname being not available
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN sum(svc2.outageCostperHour)*24

settings.description: The software selected is used by several services. Those services  have an attribute (Property) that states the average cost of downtime per hour. That cost is used to calculate the downtime cost per day in summary for all services.

reports.title: Importance Levels - List of other affected Customers (Software Issue)
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN   cu.customerImportance AS Importance, count(cu.customerImportance) AS Count ORDER BY Importance ASC

settings.description: Simulation of SLAs of affected departments / customers to understand, the possible impact on the business in case of a security issue or major software bug.

reports.title: List of other affected Customers (Software Issue)
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service  {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN cu.customerName AS Customer, cu.customerImportance AS Importance, cu.customerDept AS Department ORDER BY Importance DESC

settings.description: Simulation providing additional details on the affected departments in case of the software used for various services being down.

reports.title: Type in a Customer Name:
reports.query:
MATCH (n:`Customer`) 
WHERE toLower(toString(n.`customerName`)) CONTAINS toLower($input) 
RETURN DISTINCT n.`customerName` as value,  n.`customerName` as display ORDER BY size(toString(value)) ASC LIMIT 5

settings.description: Type in a customer name in order to analyze the services used by this customer and his department.

reports.title: Details on Software used for the Service of customer $neodash_customer_customername
reports.query:
MATCH (svr:Server)<-[:RUNS_ON]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer {customerName: $neodash_customer_customername})
RETURN DISTINCT svc.serviceName, sw.swName, sw.swVersion, sw.swLastUpdated, svr.serverName;

reports.title: SLA of customer $neodash_customer_customername
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN   count(cu.customerImportance) AS Count, cu.customerImportance AS Importance ORDER BY Importance ASC

reports.title: Importance Levels - List of other affected Customers (Software Issue)
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN   cu.customerImportance AS Importance, count(cu.customerImportance) AS Count ORDER BY Importance ASC

settings.description: Simulation of SLAs of affected departments / customers to understand, the possible impact on the business in case of a security issue or major software bug.

reports.title: List of other customers affected, using the same Software as $neodash_customer_customername
reports.query:
MATCH (svc:Service {serviceName: $neodash_service_servicename})<-[:DELIVERS]-(sw:Software)-[]->(svc2:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN cu.customerName AS Customer, cu.customerImportance AS Importance, cu.customerDept AS Department ORDER BY Importance DESC

settings.description: This table shows a list of affected Departments / Customers using the same software or service as the selected customer.

reports.title: Please ask your questions:
reports.query:
MATCH(srv:Service {serviceName: 'Service-654-ya'})-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(cust:Customer)
RETURN cust.customerName, cust.customerDept, srv.serviceSLA

settings.description:
Possible Questions to the LLM:

- Give me a list of customers using the Service Service-570-rl along with their booked SLA  and Department Name?
- How many services are running on Server server-1?
- How many services are currently running on server-11? Provide me with their names, SLA and service owners.
- Provide me customer names with SLA Level 5 running on server-27.
- What is the relation between customer Willem Orman and his booked services? Provide me the related nodes and relationships between them.

examples.question: Give me a list of customers using the Service Service-570-rl along with their booked SLA and Department Name
examples.answer:
MATCH(sv:Service {serviceName: 'Service-570-rl'})-[]->(cu:Customer)
RETURN cu.customerName, cu.customerDept, sv.serviceSLA, sv.serviceName

examples.question: How many services are running on Server server-1?
How many services are currently running on server-1? Provide me with their names, sla and service owners.
Provide me customer names with SLA Level 5 running on server-27.
examples.answer:
MATCH (s:Server {serverName: 'server027'})<-[:RUNS_ON]-(sw:Software)-[:DELIVERS]->(svc:Service)-[:CONSUMED_BY]->(c:Customer)
WHERE svc.serviceSLA = 5
RETURN c.customerName, svc.serviceSLA

examples.question: What is the relation between customer Willem Orman and his booked services? Provide me the related nodes and relationships between them.
examples.answer:
MATCH (c:Customer {customerName: 'Willem Orman'})<-[r:CONSUMED_BY]-(s:Service)
RETURN c, r, s;

2.63e7f93e-3aa4-4c11-8552-1bfc8c887f4e: Provide me customer names with SLA Level 5 running on server027.

3.63e7f93e-3aa4-4c11-8552-1bfc8c887f4e: How much does an outage of service Service-727-jb cost per day?
3.95a0a6fc-f853-412b-9594-7f17335ff497: Show me the relation between server001, the software that runs in it and the services and customers

6.63e7f93e-3aa4-4c11-8552-1bfc8c887f4e: What is the relation between customer Frederic Aronsohn and his booked services? Provide me the related nodes and relationships between them!

7.63e7f93e-3aa4-4c11-8552-1bfc8c887f4e: Give me a list of customers using the Service Service-654-ya along with their booked SLA  and Department Name?
